thread.title: 'Super blood moon' shines bright in North America
thread.title_full: 'Super blood moon' shines bright in North America | News24

author: news24.com
title: 'Super blood moon' shines bright in North America
text:
Washington - Skygazers were treated to a rare astronomical event Sunday when a swollen "supermoon" and lunar eclipse combined for the first time in decades, showing the planet bathed in blood-red light.
The celestial show, visible from the Americas, Europe, Africa, west Asia and the east Pacific, will be the result of the sun, Earth and a larger-than-life, extra-bright moon lining up for just over an hour from 02:11.
In downtown Brooklyn, crowds of people gathered on plazas and sidewalks, gazing up at the sky and trying to take photos with their smartphones.
The so-called "blood moon" was visible through much of what was a clear and seasonably pleasant early autumn evening in New York.
